perfcenter.analytical

Class Solver

  • java.lang.Object
    • perfcenter.analytical.Solver
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SolverSingleClosedMVA

    public abstract class Solver
extends java.lang.Object
    Solver is an abstract class, which contains the methods to initialize and solve models with a single class of jobs.
    Version:
    Date: 8-set-2003; Time: 9.43.21
    Author:
    Federico Granata

    • Method Detail

      • input

        public boolean input(java.lang.String[] n,
            int[] t,
            double[][] s,
            double[] v)
        Initializes the solver with the model parameters. It must be called before trying to solve the model.
        Parameters:
        n - array of n of service centers.
        t - array of the types (LD or LI) of service centers.
        s - matrix of service time of the service centers.
        v - array of visits to the service centers.
        Returns:
        true if the operation is completed with success

      • printIndexes

        public void printIndexes()
        prints all the calculated indexes in the system.out it is used to debug or test the class.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        generates a string with all the calculated indexes.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the string

      • hasSufficientProcessingCapacity

        public abstract boolean hasSufficientProcessingCapacity()
        A system is said to have sufficient capacity to process a given load lambda if no service center is saturated as a result of such a load.
        WARNING: This method should be called before solving the system.
        Returns:
        true if sufficient capacity exists for the given workload, false otherwise

      • solve

        public abstract void solve()
        Must be implemented to create a single class model solver.
